title: The Silent Docket
premise: A brilliant but ethically flexible defense attorney, known for getting the guilty acquitted, takes on the pro bono case of a man whose wife vanished a decade ago. As she digs into the cold case, she uncovers a pattern of similar disappearances, all linked to a single, untouchable federal judge—and realizes her own name is next on his list.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a charismatic and ruthless defense attorney haunted by a childhood trauma she's buried beneath a facade of ambition and cynicism.
conflict: Elara must use every shady trick in her playbook to expose a powerful judge operating a secret, extrajudicial system of 'disappearing' individuals he deems beyond the reach of the law, while evading both his vast influence and her own growing suspicion that her client is not what he seems.
setting: Present-day Boston, moving from the polished courtrooms and backroom deals of the legal elite to the city's decaying industrial underbelly.
tone: Paranoid, propulsive, and morally gray, blending the high-stakes tension of a courtroom drama with the creeping dread of a conspiracy thriller.
